data.text: @JamesHalcrow Lol they suspect wrong a mate of mine is still waiting on a PCR from Monday

@JamesHalcrow About as accurate/inaccurate as its users. If you follow the instructions correctly, it’s fine. But some ppl aren’t very good at following instructions.. this is why often non-pathology staff (nurses, midwives etc) get point-of-care tests wrong.
@JamesHalcrow Also the false positive rate of RATs is v low so if it’s positive right now u almost certainly have it
@JamesHalcrow Yeah you’ll probably be recovered by the time it gets back.
@blogboynick Yeah lol Tim did his PCR on Monday and still hasn't got his result
@JamesHalcrow Like there was a decent debate in the earlier phases but right now ur hardly gonna hold out for a PCR lol
@JamesHalcrow Which is moot since PCR is at capacity anyway
@JamesHalcrow They’re about 80% accurate I think so yeah hardly inaccurate just not as good as PCR
@blogboynick They aren't "inaccurate" though. Plenty of people are picking up their infections through RATs.
